content.text: neither the ruler nor the measuring cylinder
the measuring cylinder only
the ruler and the measuring cylinder
the ruler only
A student wishes to find the volume of a small, irregularly shaped stone
A ruler and a measuring cylinder containing some water are available
Which apparatus is needed?
a horizontal line
a vertical line
a diagonal line upwards
a curved line with increasing gradient
A car travels along a road at a constant speed
What correctly describes the speed–time graph of the car?
Four objects are moving along a straight line
The distance of each object from a fixed point on the line is plotted against time
Which object is decelerating?
An object is taken from the Earth to the Moon
The acceleration of free fall is \(9.8 \text{m/s}^2\) on the Earth and is \(1.6 \text{m/s}^2\) on the Moon
Which row describes the mass and the weight of the object on the Moon compared to on the Earth?

table.html:
massweight
Agreater than on the Earthsame as on the Earth
Bless than on the Earthsame as on the Earth
Csame as on the Earthgreater than on the Earth
Dsame as on the Earthless than on the Earth

36 g/ cm³
320 g/ cm³

The velocity of the object changes
The mass of the object changes
The weight of the object changes
A single force acts upon an object and the volume of the object does **not** change

Four electric motors do the same quantity of work when they lift a weight of 10 N through the same distance
The times taken by each motor to lift the weight are shown
What is the time taken by the motor which produces the most power?
Which row describes how the pressure beneath the surface of a liquid depends on the depth below the surface and on the density of the liquid?

table.html:
depth below surfacedensity of liquid
Apressure decreases with increasing depthpressure decreases with increasing density
Bpressure decreases with increasing depthpressure increases with increasing density
Cpressure increases with increasing depthpressure decreases with increasing density
Dpressure increases with increasing depthpressure increases with increasing density

condensing

The water absorbs heat from the surroundings

Energy is not conserved

bridges
railway lines
telephone cables
thermostats

pin is attached to each end of the rod by wax
The rod is heated at the centre
A pin falls off when the wax melts

Pin P falls off first because aluminium is a better thermal conductor than glass
Pin P falls off first because aluminium is a worse thermal conductor than glass
Pin Q falls off first because glass is a better thermal conductor than aluminium
Pin Q falls off first because glass is a worse thermal conductor than aluminium

White surfaces are good conductors of infrared radiation
White surfaces are good absorbers of infrared radiation
White surfaces are good emitters of infrared radiation

amplitude
period
wavefront
wavelength

Waves on the surface of water travel from deep water to shallow water
Which diagram shows the correct path of the waves in the shallow water?

The beam converges to a point to the right of \(\mathsf{F}_{2}\)
The beam diverges from a point to the left of \(\mathsf{F}_{1}\)
The beam travels parallel to the principal axis

dispersion of light by a prism
reflection in a plane mirror

20 Hz to 2000 Hz

The time between the student hitting the blocks and hearing the echo is 0.59 s
What is the distance between the student and the wall?

content.text: Which graph of voltage against time shows an a.c. voltage?

the energy transferred by the resistor

If the outer casing is a conductor, it should be earthed
If the outer casing is a conductor, it should **not** be earthed
If the outer casing is an insulator, it should be earthed
If the outer casing is an insulator, it should **not** be earthed

1, 2 and 3
1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only

It contains negatively charged particles only

number of electronslocation of electrons
